channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gail Slater Is The Perfect Pick To Lead The Trump DOJ’s Fight Against Big Tech
item.description: Everyone across the political spectrum — except, of course, tech giants and their paid shills in D.C. — should welcome the nomination of Gail Slater.

item.title: Climbing the Ladder in Finance: The PIE Framework for Investment Professionals
item.description: Promotions require more than just hard work and results. By mastering the PIE framework, you’ll position yourself for long-term career success.

item.title: The Endowment Syndrome: Why Elite Funds Are Falling Behind
item.description: Endowments have long been considered elite investors, but outdated strategies and skyrocketing costs are eroding their edge

item.title: People Who Fought In Afghanistan Know Why Nation-Building Was Never Going To Work
item.description: In Afghanistan, tribalism is at a virtually unparalleled level. Westerners have no idea how deeply disturbing that tribalism can be.

item.title: States Should Stop Subsidizing Union Politicking
item.description: In almost every state, government workers are doing labor unions’ political bidding on the taxpayer’s dime. This must end.

item.title: Clock is ticking: TikTok could go dark in U.S. on Jan. 19 as federal court upholds ban
item.description: A federal appeals court in Washington on Friday upheld a law banning TikTok in the U.S. unless it's sold by Jan. 19.

item.title: AOC launches bid for top Democratic role on House Oversight Committee
item.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez announced she is running for the top Democratic position on the House Oversight Committee next congress.

item.title: The University of Michigan’s Shift on DEI Is Only a Start
item.description: It will take a lot more to fix the damage the woke agenda has inflicted on higher ed.

item.title: The Week: President Biden Pardons His Son
item.description: Plus: The spectacular failure of a South Korean self-coup.

item.title: How the Yale Women’s Center Was Colonized by Pro-Hamas Radicalism
item.description: While Jewish women may be welcomed elsewhere on campus, the Yale Women’s Center remains an anti-Israel advocacy organization.

item.title: Boeing’s plea deal shot down by judge because the independent monitor would be a DEI hire
item.description: The scandal-plagued aerospace group has 30 days to come up with a new plan with the Justice Department.

item.title: Super Micro just hired a new auditor that might save it from getting the boot from Nasdaq
item.description: The Nvidia-adjacent server maker hired BDO USA after its former auditor quit because it couldn’t trust the management team or the board of directors.

item.title: Slain UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson’s tenure was marked by rocketing profits—and accusations of insider trading and coverage denial

item.title: Trump appoints former Sen. David Perdue to be ambassador to China
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday announced that he picked former Sen. David Perdue to serve as U.S. ambassador to China.

item.title: Venezuelan Busted For Extorting Illegals In PA Exposes Evil Side Effect Of Biden’s Open Borders

item.title: Tesla jumps as Elon Musk’s ‘bet for the ages’ on Trump is seen paying off with federal self-driving rules

item.title: Reining In Federal Spending Must Start With The Executive Branch
item.description: For years going on decades, presidents of both parties have used executive action to spend money Congress never fully authorized.

item.title: Top law enforcement official sounds alarm about bloodthirsty Venezuelan gang operating in red state

item.title: Four Ways Trump Can Scrap Biden’s ‘Equity’ Discrimination And Promote Real Equality
item.description: There are at least four steps Trump can take immediately to make good on campaign promises to vanquish DEI from the federal bureaucracy.
